Tips.title: Essential Need
Tips.description: Use 'require' when something is a necessity, not just a desire.
Tips.example: Surviving the desert requires carrying ample water.

Tips.title: Non-negotiable
Tips.description: 'Require' suggests you can't do without it; stronger than just needing.

senses.de: To make it necessary for someone to do something
senses.ex: The law requires that you must wear a seatbelt when driving.

Tips.title: Legal Obligation
Tips.description: Used when there's an obligation by law or rules. It's about must-dos.
Tips.example: Visitors require a pass to enter the building.

Tips.title: Imposed Condition
Tips.description: When 'require' means to impose, it leaves no room for choice.
Tips.example: The contract requires your signature before Friday.

senses.de: To ask someone to do something
senses.ex: I require you to clean your room.

Tips.title: Formal Request
Tips.description: A formal request or order, usually from a position of authority.
Tips.example: My boss requires me to submit a report by tomorrow.

Tips.title: Personal Requirement
Tips.description: Even in personal contexts, 'require' can express strong needs.
Tips.example: The plants require regular trimming to flourish.

senses.de: To depend on something for success or to happen
senses.ex: Hiking this trail requires a good level of fitness.

Tips.title: Precondition
Tips.description: 'Require' suggests conditions that must be met for success.
Tips.example: Joining the team requires passing a fitness test.

Tips.title: Implicit Consequence
Tips.description: Failing to meet a 'requirement' could lead to negative outcomes.
Tips.example: Neglecting the required safety measures could result in accidents.

Call for.wordDefinition:
Call for implies a need or a demand for something, while require implies a necessity or an obligation for something.

For example, if a situation 'calls for' urgent action, it means that action is needed immediately to resolve the problem.

If someone requires medical attention, it means that they need medical treatment because it is necessary for their health.

Call for describes situations that demand attention or action, whereas require describes conditions that must be met or fulfilled.

Demand.wordDefinition:
Demand means to forcefully ask for something, while require simply means to need something.

For example, if someone demands that you give them your phone, they are telling you that you have to give it to them or else there will be consequences.

Demand implies that there may be some kind of pressure or threat behind the request, while require is a more neutral term that simply states what is necessary for something to happen.

Necessitate.wordDefinition:
Both necessitate and require indicate the need for something.

However, necessitate means something is essential or indispensable for a particular purpose or outcome, while require simply means something is needed or demanded.

For example, a medical emergency may necessitate immediate attention, meaning it is absolutely necessary for the person's survival.

Necessitate implies a higher level of urgency or importance, while require is more neutral and can be used in a wider range of situations.

Need.wordDefinition:
Need implies a necessity or something that is necessary for survival. For example, you need food, water, and air to survive.

Need is more commonly used in everyday situations whereas require is typically used in more formal or professional settings.

Oblige.wordDefinition:
Oblige means to do something because it is polite, necessary, or expected. For example, if someone invites you to their party, it is polite to bring a gift or some food to share.

You feel obliged to bring something to the party to show your appreciation for being invited.

Oblige is used when there is a social expectation or customary behavior while require is used when there is a demand or specific need.
